chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
lq: Ordered.sort Label
lc: Ordered.sort Label
cn: nid
pts: seq nid
Lab_neq: is_true (lq != lc)
Hnin: is_true (cn \notin pts)
Puniq: is_true (uniq pts)
PtsNonEmpty: is_true (pts != [::])
serialize: Data -> seq nat
deserialize: seq nat -> Data
ds_inverse: left_inverse serialize deserialize
l: Equality.sort Label
i: UMC.sort (union_mapUMC Label dstatelet)

Goal:
l \notin dom (cT:=union_mapUMC Label dstatelet) i -> getStatelet i l = empty_dstatelet

Premises:
is_true = eq^~ true : bool -> Prop Arguments is_true _%bool_scope is_true is a coercion
Record dstatelet : Type := DStatelet { dstate : lstate_type heap; dsoup : soup }
left_inverse = fun (A B : Type) (op : A -> B) (inv : B -> A) => forall x : A, inv (op x) = x : forall A B : Type, (A -> B) -> (B -> A) -> Prop Arguments left_inverse {A B}%type_scope (_ _)%function_scope
sort : forall T : Type, rel T -> seq T -> seq T
empty_dstatelet = {| dstate := empty_lstate [::]; dsoup := Unit |} : dstatelet
uniq = fun T : eqType => fix uniq (s : seq T) : bool := match s with | [::] => true | x :: s' => (x \notin s') && uniq s' end : forall T : eqType, seq T -> bool Arguments uniq {T} _%seq_scope
dom : forall (K : ordType) (V : Type) (cT : union_map_class K V), cT -> seq K
nid = nat : Set
getStatelet = fun (s : state) (i : Label) => match find (cT:=union_mapUMC Label dstatelet) i s with | Some d => d | None => empty_dstatelet end : state -> Label -> dstatelet
Data = (nat * Log)%type : Type
Notation seq := list
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
Label = [ordType of nat] : ordType
union_mapUMC : forall (K : ordType) (V : Type), union_map_class K V
axioms.dyn : forall (interp : ?C -> Type) (A : ?C), interp A -> {x : ?C & interp x} where ?C : [lc : Label lq : Label cn : nid pts : seq nid Lab_neq : lq != lc Hnin : cn \notin pts Puniq : uniq pts PtsNonEmpty : pts != [::] serialize : Data -> seq nat deserialize : seq nat -> Data ds_inverse : left_inverse serialize deserialize l : Label i : union_mapUMC Label dstatelet |- Type]
getSUn : forall (s1 s2 : union_map_classPCM (union_mapUMC Label dstatelet)) (l : Label), valid (s1 \+ s2) -> l \in dom (cT:=union_mapUMC Label dstatelet) s1 -> getStatelet s1 l = getStatelet (s1 \+ s2) l
QueryHooked.tryrecv_resp_obligation_1 : forall (lq : Label) (pc : protocol) (Data : Type) (qnodes : seq nat) (serialize : Data -> seq nat) (core_state_to_data : nid -> heap -> Data -> Prop), lq != plab pc -> forall (rid : nat) (to : nid) (l : Label) (n : nid) (t : nat) (m : seq nat), [&& l == lq, n == to, t == tresp, head 0 m == rid & to \in qnodes] -> l \in dom (cT:=union_mapUMC Label protocol) (QueryHooked.W lq pc Data qnodes serialize core_state_to_data)
hooks_frame : forall (U W : world) (K : hooks) (l : Label) (st : nat_ordType) (s : union_mapUMC Label dstatelet) (s' : union_map_classPCM (union_mapUMC Label dstatelet)) (n : nid) (msg : seq nat) (to : nid), hook_complete U -> hook_complete W -> hooks_consistent (U \+ W).1 K -> l \in dom (cT:=union_mapUMC Label dstatelet) s -> s \In Coh U -> s \+ s' \In Coh (U \+ W \+ (Unit, K)) -> not_hooked_by K l -> all_hooks_fire U l st s n msg to -> all_hooks_fire (U \+ W \+ (Unit, K)) l st (s \+ s') n msg to
getsE : forall (l : Label) (s : union_mapUMC Label dstatelet), l \in dom (cT:=union_mapUMC Label dstatelet) s -> find (cT:=union_mapUMC Label dstatelet) l s = Some (getStatelet s l)

locProjR : forall (W1 W2 : world) (l : Label) (s1 s2 : union_mapPCM Label dstatelet), s1 \+ s2 \In Coh (W1 \+ W2) -> l \in dom (cT:=union_mapUMC Label protocol) W2.1 -> s2 \In Coh W2 -> getStatelet (s1 \+ s2) l = getStatelet s2 l
locProjL : forall (W1 W2 : world) (l : Label) (s1 s2 : union_mapPCM Label dstatelet), s1 \+ s2 \In Coh (W1 \+ W2) -> l \in dom (cT:=union_mapUMC Label protocol) W1.1 -> s1 \In Coh W1 -> getStatelet (s1 \+ s2) l = getStatelet s1 l
all_hooks_fire = fun (h : hooks) (l : Label) (st : nat_ordType) (s : union_mapUMC Label dstatelet) (n : nid) (msg : seq nat) (to : nid) => forall (z : nat_ordType) (lc : Label) (hk : hook_type), Some hk = find (cT:=union_mapUMC (prod_ordType (prod_ordType nat_ordType Label) (prod_ordType Label nat_ordType)) hook_type) (z, lc, (l, st)) h -> lc \in dom (cT:=union_mapUMC Label dstatelet) s -> l \in dom (cT:=union_mapUMC Label dstatelet) s -> hk (getLocal n (getStatelet s lc)) (getLocal n (getStatelet s l)) msg to : hooks -> Label -> nat_ordType -> union_mapUMC Label dstatelet -> nid -> seq nat -> nid -> Prop Arguments all_hooks_fire _ _ _ _ _ _%seq_scope
